Claim: "A little boy looks disgusted that his ball is dirty."
Implication: "It looks like quite a sweaty, smelly dog pile over one little rugby ball."
Referring expressions: little boy, ball, disgusted  It, little rugby ball, dog pile, smelly, sweaty
Properties: IsLittle(a),  IsDirty(b),  IsDisgusted(c)  IsSmelly(f),  IsSweaty(h),  IsDogPile(e)
Formula: (exists c (exists a (exists b (IsLittle(a) and IsDirty(b) and IsDisgusted(c)))) & (forall i (forall j ( IsSmelly(i) ->   IsDisgusted(j))))) -> (exists f (exists e (exists h (IsSmelly(f) and (IsSweaty(h) and IsDogPile(e))))))
